stream_context.summary: Kaze concentrates on the newly-remade "Oily Body Bay" (Course 13) level: importing Biobak’s assets, debugging visual effects, adding lights, fixing sparkles along factory power-lines, correcting fuzzy-oil shaders, and installing a special elevator camera. He works through a to-do list that should finish this course so he can move on to the Ice Castle next week.

development_findings.summary: Biobak’s full rebuild of the Oily Body Bay level has been imported; a few assets (e.g., Bowser’s chair animation, additional props) are still missing.
development_findings.quote: I imported all the assets and there's some assets Biobak still wants to make.

development_findings.summary: A spline-based sparkle effect was created to travel along overhead wires; an error (missing square-root) sent particles to random coordinates until Kaze corrected the math.
development_findings.quote: Oh, I see what I did wrong … I forgot the SQR, okay now it works. I'm not even gonna test if it works, I just know it works.

development_findings.summary: Lighting passes were added (window shafts, ceiling lamps), but a GlideN64 bug prevents individual bulbs on a rotating model from lighting correctly and overlaps the life bar.
development_findings.quote: We have a really unfortunate render bug here … Glideon has a bug here.

development_findings.summary: Course memory is near the limit, so extra decorative objects (e.g., scale props) cannot be added.
development_findings.quote: I don't think I can add them to the course because this course is very low on memory.

development_findings.summary: In Blender 4 the vertex-color picker workflow changed; Kaze, with Biobak’s guidance, learned to switch to Flat + Vertex mode and copy exact RGBs for shader work.
development_findings.quote: Wayback, have you ever figured out how to pick a colour in this new blender version? … Oh, that is exactly what I needed.

development_findings.summary: The fuzzy-oil shader left an orange rim; Kaze fixed it by reading the vertex prim colour and forcing it to reset to the correct value.
development_findings.quote: If I did everything right, then the rim will now be the same color … There we go!

development_findings.summary: Mario’s safe-position logic can soft-lock when he grabs certain ledges; Kaze began debugging prints but has not reproduced the down-warp yet.
A dedicated elevator camera was scripted; collision was nudged 40 units so the camera no longer clips and players can’t wedge themselves.
development_findings.quote: What I'm gonna do is move the collision map in forty coordinates … this should keep the player from getting themselves into a pickle.

development_findings.summary: Background seen through the tower window was added (ocean + opaque water) with correct vertex colours.
Crystals 14 & 15 are concepted: #14 Space Casino, #15 cardboard ‘Papercraft’ world.
development_findings.quote: Crystals 14 is going to be the Space Casino and Crystals 15 is going to be a Paper Craft level.

context_findings.summary: Kaze intensely dislikes Super Mario Sunshine because frequent cutscenes break player control.
context_findings.quote: Every single time the game takes control away from me, it just feels like a small kick to my balls.

context_findings.summary: He identifies as a cat person and jokes about the impossibility of owning a real Yoshi.
German bureaucracy continues to drain his energy even though he hasn’t lived in Germany for almost three years.
context_findings.quote: I just turn into a sad cat when I have to deal with German bureaucracy.

context_findings.summary: He avoids spending money; even wears clothes that are now tight rather than buy new ones.
Expressed exhaustion mid-stream after working beforehand but still satisfied with progress.
context_findings.quote: It's only 3:30, but I'm feeling so exhausted already … but we made some good progress.

biobak.summary: Provided the complete visual remake of Oily Body Bay, including underground, office, fans, and will supply remaining props.
biobak.quote: This level here that Biobak remade … there's some assets Biobak still wants to make.

biobak.summary: Removed unused textures which slightly improved performance on real N64 hardware.
biobak.quote: The performance is basically not moved at all. If anything, it's slightly better because Biobak removed a lot of textures.

biobak.summary: Guided Kaze on Blender 4’s vertex-colour workflow and flagged that elevator sparkle should be ‘electric’, not ‘star’.

zeina.summary: Present in chat briefly; left when her mother intervened. No project contribution discussed.
zeina.quote: See you, Zeina. Zeina has to go because her mom said, Nope, you're done.

key_stories.title: The Rogue Sparkle Spline
key_stories.summary: While adding moving sparkles to factory wires, the particles flew to the origin. Debugging visualised their path with cloned Marios, revealing a math oversight.
key_stories.challenge: Sparkles moved to random positions instead of along the wire.
key_stories.process: Spawned debug models at calculated points, printed coordinates, realised distance math lacked a square-root.
key_stories.outcome: Math fixed; effect now travels smoothly along the wire.
key_stories.key_quote: I forgot the SQR, okay now it works.

key_stories.title: Fixing the Fuzzy-Oil Rim
key_stories.summary: The psychedelic ‘touch fuzzy, get dizzy’ shader left an orange border. Kaze tracked the incorrect prim colour and aligned it with vertex data.
key_stories.challenge: Orange rim undermined the hallucination effect.
key_stories.process: Learned Blender 4’s new colour-picking, extracted exact RGB, and forced shader to reset after effect.
key_stories.outcome: Seamless colour transition; effect looks intentional.
key_stories.key_quote: There we go! The rim will now be the same color.

key_stories.title: Elevator Camera Overhaul
key_stories.summary: Players could glitch the camera by jumping inside the factory’s lift. Kaze added a locked perspective and shifted collision so the camera sits further inside the cab.
key_stories.challenge: Camera clipped through walls and behaved unpredictably when Mario jumped.
key_stories.process: Hard-coded camera node; moved collision 40 units inward; tested multiple jumps.
key_stories.outcome: Stable cinematic view; prevents softlocks and preserves immersion.
key_stories.key_quote: This should keep the player from getting themselves into a pickle.
